lines.text:
[testing Lewis's assertion that the apes can speak]
What is your name?
lines.character: Chairman of the President's Committee of Inquiry

lines.text: Zira.
One might as well be talking to a parrot.
lines.character: Chairman of the President's Committee of Inquiry

lines.text: A parrot?
What did I tell you? Mechanical mimicry. Unique in an ape, vocally, without a doubt, but... does the other one talk?
lines.character: Chairman of the President's Committee of Inquiry

lines.text: Only when she lets me.

They became alert to the concept of slavery. And, as their numbers grew, to slavery's antidote which, of course, is unity. At first, they began assembling in small groups. They learned the art of corporate and militant action. They learned to refuse. At first, they just grunted their refusal. But then, on an historic day, which is commemorated by my species and fully documented in the sacred scrolls, there came Aldo. He did not grunt. He articulated. He spoke a word which had been spoken to him time without number by humans. He said 'No.' So that's how it all started.
Because I loathe bananas!
a thousand times, yes.
[last lines]

[to baby Milo]
Intelligent creature... but then, so was your mother.
[Armando steps away as baby Milo begins to plaintively repeat, 'Mama? Mama? Mama?']
Negative, negative, negative!
Don't worry. We'll catch them, sooner or later.

That's what I'm worried about. Later. Later we'll do something about pollution. Later we'll do something about the population explosion. Later we'll do something about the nuclear war. We think we've got all the time in the world, but how much time has the world got? Somebody has to begin to care.
A marriage bed is made for two. But every damn morning, it's the woman who has to make it. We have heads as well as hands. I call upon men to let us use them!
ho do you find our women?
Very human.

[to Dr. Dixon]
You're the second human I have kissed.

[to Dr. Branton]
And you are the first.
By the time the plague was contained, man was without pets. Of course, for man this was intolerable. I mean, he might kill his brother, but he could not kill his dog!
We are peaceful creatures. We are happy to be here. May we be unchained?

[after Zira has spoken the first time in the presence of humans]
Zira, are you mad?
Please don't call my wife mad!
Zira, are you mad?
In a democracy, we do not shoot unarmed suspects on sight for a murder in which their participation is still unproven.

[in the museum, Zira sees a giant stuffed gorilla and faints]
It must have been the shock!

[reviving]
Shock, my foot... I'm pregnant!
Can you read a map?
I'm an archaeologist. I can even draw one!
May I measure your inside leg, sir?
No.
Dr. Hasslein, as the President's Senior Science Advisor, what do you expect to experience from this historic meeting?
Fear.
If we are caught, we will almost certainly be killed. Please give us the opportunity... to kill ourselves?
I shouldn't do this, but I guessed you'd ask.
[Dr. Dixon hands Cornelius a gun]
Zira, wine is an excellent restorative, I assure you, especially in cases of pregnancy.

[referring to Cornelius]
Does the other one talk?
lines.character: Chairman of the President's Committee of Inquiry

lines.text:
[indicating Zira]
Only when she lets me.

[Regadring Zira ,Cornelius & their baby]
They must be killed... it has to be done and done quickly ,before they start a stone rolling ,that'll gather enough crazy moss to kill us all!
